</image>   <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BISAENVWG;77a66a13.1503">   <title>Resource Politics: Transforming pathways to sustainability, 7-9 September 2015 </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BISAENVWG;77a66a13.1503</link>   <description> FYI...<br><br>*Resource Politics: Transforming pathways to sustainability New delegate<br>places released | Call for posters*<br><br>The ESRC STEPS Centre is delighted to announce our annual conference, *Resource<br>Politics: transforming pathways to sustainability*<br>&lt;http://resourcepolitics2015.wordpress.com/about/&gt;, to be held at the<br>Institute of Development Studies on 7-9 September 2015.<br><br>Among the plenary speakers are: Rohan D\ufffd\ufffd\ufffdSouza, Betsy Hartmann, Melissa<br>Leach, Johan Rockstr\ufffd\ufffdm and Michael Watts with those among the panel<br>speakers including Tor Benjaminsen, Esteve Corbera, Wendy Harcourt and<br>Kathleen McAfee. [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2015-03-09T11:48:59+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Hayley Stevenson</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BISAENVWG;77a66a13.1503</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BISAENVWG;6759939c.1502">   <title>Final Call for Abstracts for a fully funded workshop: Novel Approaches to Climate Governance and the role of Entrepreneurship </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BISAENVWG;6759939c.1502</link>   <description> [cid:image003.jpg@01D050E1.AC225820]<br>Entrepreneurship and climate governance<br>Predictions of climate change paint an alarming picture and addressing the ensuing risks will require the introduction of radically novel public and private policies that help cut emissions and increase preparedness and resilience vis-\ufffd\ufffd-vis what now seem to be unavoidable effects of climate change.<br><br>This workshop will bring together 20-25 scholars under the flag of the COST Action INOGOV<http://www.inogov.eu/> (Innovations in Climate Governance) to discuss the role of entrepreneurship in bringing about radical transitions in climate governance. Entrepreneurial initiatives are often regarded as absolutely crucial for the kind of policy invention and innovation processes that [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2015-02-25T09:58:58+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Andy Jordan (ENV)</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BISAENVWG;6759939c.1502</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BISAENVWG;45042903.1502">   <title>Postdoctoral position at University College Cork </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BISAENVWG;45042903.1502</link>   <description> Dear all,<br><br>Please see below an 18 month postdoctoral position at University College<br>Cork, Ireland, on a project the aim of which is to design a<br>socially-inclusive financial instrument to attract investment capital to<br>resource efficient assets.<br><br>Best wishes,<br><br>Diarmuid<br><br>--<br>*Dr. Diarmuid Torney*<br><br>Lecturer in International Relations<br>School of Law and Government<br>Dublin City University<br>Glasnevin<br>Dublin 9<br>Ireland<br><br>Tel. +353 1 700 6468<br>Email: diarmuid.torney@dcu.ie<br>Skype. diarmuidtorney<br>Twitter: @diarmuidtorney [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2015-02-15T11:59:22+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Diarmuid Torney</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BISAENVWG;45042903.1502</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BISAENVWG;e7417acd.1502">   <title>Call for papers on panel: \ufffd\ufffd\ufffdCan the Green Economy save the climate?\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd Paris 7-10 July 2015</title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BISAENVWG;e7417acd.1502</link>   <description> ** Apologies for cross-posting**<br><br>*Our Common Future Under Climate Change<br>&lt;http://www.commonfuture-paris2015.org/How-to-Contribute/Contributions.htm&gt;*<br><br>*Paris, 7-10 July 2015*<br><br>*Deadline for abstracts: 2 March 2015*<br><br>*Parallel Session: Green Transition and Growth*<br><br>*Proposed Panel: \ufffd\ufffd\ufffdCan the Green Economy save the climate?\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd*<br><br>The United Nations Conference on Sustainable Development in June 2012<br>(Rio+20) has given way to a heated debate about the \ufffd\ufffd\ufffdgreen economy\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd, a<br>concept promoted by United Nations Organizations (e.g. UNEP, 2012<br>&lt;#14b7ec3658dab9b8__ENREF_4&gt;) with the aim to sketch a desirable and<br>practicable way out of the multiple environmental and social crises the<br>world faces today. The green economy is a concept that has its [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2015-02-13T10:06:21+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Hayley Stevenson</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BISAENVWG;e7417acd.1502</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BISAENVWG;be68a102.1502">   <title>Fwd: [Degrowth] Summer School on Degrowth and Environmental Justice: July 06-15/2015 </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BISAENVWG;be68a102.1502</link>   <description> Dear colleagues,<br><br>This summer school might interest you or your students.<br><br>Best wishes,<br>Hayley<br><br>---------- Forwarded message ----------<br>From: &lt;network@degrowth.net&gt;<br>Date: 6 February 2015 at 17:16<br>Subject: [Degrowth] Summer School on Degrowth and Environmental Justice:<br>July 06-15/2015<br>To: degrowth@lists.degrowth.be<br><br>**Please spread the word among your networks**<br><br>*Summer School on Degrowth and Environmental Justice: July 2015*<br><br>We have the pleasure of inviting you to the second edition of the summer<br>school on degrowth offered by ICTA (www.uab.cat/icta) and Research &amp;<br>Degrowth (www.degrowth.org), this year with environmental justice as a<br>special focus. The summer school will take place between the 6th and [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2015-02-06T18:50:12+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Hayley Stevenson</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BISAENVWG;be68a102.1502</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BISAENVWG;47fea2b8.1502">   <title>Call for papers, ECPR Montreal: Conceptual Foundations of Earth System Governance </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BISAENVWG;47fea2b8.1502</link>   <description> ** Apologies for cross-posting**<br><br>*ECPR General Conference*<br><br>*Universit\ufffd\ufffd de Montr\ufffd\ufffdal 26 - 29 August 2015*<br><br>http://www.ecpr.eu/Events/EventDetails.aspx?EventID=94<br><br>*Section: *Environmental Politics<br><br>*Panel title: *Conceptual Foundations of Earth System Governance<br><br>*Panel chairs: *James Meadowcroft (Carleton) and Hayley Stevenson<br>(Sheffield)<br><br>*Description*: This panel will bring together papers exploring the key<br>ideas that are framing debates around environmental governance during a<br>period of global environmental change and earth system transformation. We<br>anticipate papers focused on particular concepts (such as \ufffd\ufffd\ufffdplanetary<br>boundaries\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd, \ufffd\ufffd\ufffdenvironmental limits\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd, \ufffd\ufffd\ufffdthe Anthropocene\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd, \ufffd\ufffd\ufffdresilience\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd, \ufffd\ufffd\ufffdthe<br>green economy\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd, etc.), as well as theoretical papers exploring the<br>relationship between conceptual innovation and institutional innovation. [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2015-02-03T16:08:06+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Hayley Stevenson</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BISAENVWG;47fea2b8.1502</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BISAENVWG;f3403d8d.1501">   <title>Workshop Securitization and Environment - Geneva (9-10 Feb.) </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BISAENVWG;f3403d8d.1501</link>   <description> Dear colleagues,<br><br>We have the pleasure to announce the organization of the 2nd Workshop on<br>Environment and Security, as part of the WES project<br>&lt;http://wes-series.ulb.ac.be/&gt; supported by Sciences Po Paris, the<br>University of Geneva, the ULB, the University of Economics of Bratislava,<br>and the Fletcher School of Tufts University.<br><br>The workshop will be on &quot;*Securitization Theories and the Environment*&quot; and<br>will take place in *Geneva on Feb. 9th and 10th*. [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2015-01-28T18:28:03+01:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Lucile MAERTENS</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BISAENVWG;f3403d8d.1501</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BISAENVWG;69ef499e.1412">   <title>Novel Approaches to Climate Governance and the role of Entrepreneurship: Funded workshop abstract call </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BISAENVWG;69ef499e.1412</link>   <description> Novel Approaches to Climate Governance and the role of Entrepreneurship<br>18-19 May 2015, Amsterdam<br>Entrepreneurship and climate governance<br>Predictions of climate change paint an alarming picture and addressing the ensuing risks will require the introduction of radically different public and private policies that cut emissions, promote adaptation and encourage resilience. This fully funded workshop will bring together 20-25 scholars under the flag of the COST Action INOGOV<http://www.inogov.eu/> (Innovations in Climate Governance) to discuss the role of entrepreneurship in bringing about radical transitions in climate governance. Entrepreneurial initiatives are often regarded as absolutely crucial for the kind of policy invention and [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2014-12-22T15:58:50+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Andy Jordan (ENV)</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BISAENVWG;69ef499e.1412</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BISAENVWG;581604fc.1412">   <title>PhD Dissertation Fellowship Award: Academic Council on the UN System </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BISAENVWG;581604fc.1412</link>   <description> Dear BISA Envt Working Group colleagues<br><br>Please find below information on the ACUNS PhD Dissertation Fellowship Award which might be of interest to your PhD students. I've asked for this information to be circulated to the BISA membership more generally, but wanted to get this out to you all specifically. I take over as ACUNS Chair in June next year at the Annual Meeting in the Hague and am very keen to use my three-year stint to build networks of colleagues working on the UN system and environment and natural resources issues. [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2014-12-15T08:36:12+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Lorraine Elliott</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BISAENVWG;581604fc.1412</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BISAENVWG;66b1e183.1412">   <title>Call for Papers: Environment Panels at BISA PGN Conference </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BISAENVWG;66b1e183.1412</link>   <description> Dear colleagues,<br><br>Please share this with PhD students in your departments. There are three<br>separate environmental politics panels being planned for the postgraduate<br>conference. All details below.<br><br>Best wishes,<br><br>Hayley<br><br>*Call for Papers for BISA PGN Conference*<br><br>Following last year\ufffd\ufffd\ufffds biggest ever BISA Postgraduate Network conference in<br>Dublin, Ireland,<br>&lt;http://bisapgn.com/events/past-conferences/pgn-conference-2014/&gt; this<br>year\ufffd\ufffd\ufffds BISA PGN Annual Conference will be taking place at King\ufffd\ufffd\ufffds College<br>London in the heart of London. *It will take place on the 30th March, 2015.* [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2014-12-08T16:35:41-03:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Hayley Stevenson</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BISAENVWG;66b1e183.1412</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BISAENVWG;d4361436.1412">   <title>Fwd: [Degrowth] Call for Hosting the 5th International Conference on Degrowth (To be held in 2016) </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BISAENVWG;d4361436.1412</link>   <description> FYI<br><br>---------- Forwarded message ----------<br>From: &lt;network@degrowth.net&gt;<br>Date: Mon, Dec 1, 2014 at 6:18 PM<br>Subject: [Degrowth] Call for Hosting the 5th International Conference on<br>Degrowth (To be held in 2016)<br>To:<br><br>Please, Disseminate widely...<br><br>*Open Call for Hosting the Fifth International Conference on Degrowth for<br>Ecological Sustainability and Social Equity*<br><br>The international conferences on degrowth<br>&lt;http://www.degrowth.org/conferences&gt; are central landmarks and moments of<br>convergence of the international degrowth<br>&lt;http://www.degrowth.org/definition-2&gt; intellectual and social movement.<br>They offer an unique opportunity for bringing together scholars with other<br>members of civil society and demonstrating a different way of organizing<br>conferences. A central feature of [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2014-12-01T18:46:13+01:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Viviana Asara</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BISAENVWG;d4361436.1412</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BISAENVWG;47ce1194.1411">   <title>Fwd: FW: Climate Policy - COP21 Research conference: call for session proposals </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BISAENVWG;47ce1194.1411</link>   <description> FYI<br><br>-----Original Message-----<br>From: onbehalfof+editor+climatepolicyjournal.org@manuscriptcentral.com<br>[mailto:onbehalfof+editor+climatepolicyjournal.org@manuscriptcentral.com]<br>On Behalf Of editor@climatepolicyjournal.org<br>Sent: 21 November 2014 12:21<br>To: Sevasti-Eleni Vezirgiannidou (Department of Political Science and<br>International Studies)<br>Subject: Climate Policy - COP21 Research conference: call for session<br>proposals<br><br>21-Nov-2014<br><br>Dear Colleague,<br><br>I would like to draw your attention to an important and unique event for<br>the worldwide academic community engaged in climate issues ahead of the<br>UNFCCC COP21 hosted by France in 2015. The International Scientific<br>Conference \ufffd\ufffd\ufffdOur Common Future Under Climate Change\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd, initiated with the<br>support of the COP21 Presidency (<br>http://tandf.msgfocus.com/c/119iuUFKG0EbrVqD8OQg9TwZ), will take place from<br>7-10 July 2015 in Paris. [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2014-11-21T17:23:10+01:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Hayley Stevenson</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BISAENVWG;47ce1194.1411</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BISAENVWG;19d1068a.1411">   <title>PhD Studentships in Environmental Social Science </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BISAENVWG;19d1068a.1411</link>   <description> The School of Environmental Sciences at UEA invites applications for its prestigious graduate studies programme in over 40 topic areas, ranging from governance and policy, through to economics, human geography and sociology:<br><br>https://www.uea.ac.uk/study/postgraduate/research-degrees/phds-and-studentships/environmental-sciences<br><br>Home to major centres of excellence including the Tyndall Centre, CSERGE and 3S, the School of Environmental Sciences is one of the longest established, largest and most fully developed interdisciplinary institutions of its kind anywhere in Europe. It provides a stimulating, innovative and supportive research environment in which graduate students can fruitfully explore natural and human environments, and their myriad interactions and inter-connections. [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2014-11-21T12:41:26+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Andy Jordan (ENV)</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BISAENVWG;19d1068a.1411</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BISAENVWG;4efc0e96.1411">   <title>Call for papers: The External Dimension of EU Environmental Policy </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BISAENVWG;4efc0e96.1411</link>   <description> *Call for papers*<br><br>*Workshop*<br><br>*\ufffd\ufffd\ufffdThe External Dimension of European Union Environmental Policy \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd pursuing<br>environmental norms, rules and policies beyond borders\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd*<br><br>*2-4 June 2015 \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd The Centre for the Study of Governance Innovation,<br>University of Pretoria, South Africa*<br><br>*Context*<br><br>The European Union (EU) has a hugely important effect on the way in which<br>environmental policies are framed and implemented not just in Europe but in<br>many different parts of the world. After more than 40 years of continuous<br>development, the environmental sector is one of the most successful and<br>popular aspects of EU integration. However, as internal EU environmental<br>policy [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2014-11-21T10:45:34+02:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Camilla Adelle</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BISAENVWG;4efc0e96.1411</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BISAENVWG;b39541ee.1411">   <title>special issue of geopolitics on rethinking climate security </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BISAENVWG;b39541ee.1411</link>   <description> Dear all,<br><br>With apologies for cross-posting, this special issue just out may be of interest:<br><br>http://www.tandfonline.com/toc/fgeo20/current#.VGtB2YdsfLc<br><br>Best wishes<br>Jan<br><br>Jan Selby<br>Professor of International Relations<br>Director, Sussex Centre for Conflict and Security Research<br>University of Sussex<br>Brighton BN1 9QN, UK<br>Tel: 00-44-1273-876694<br>Profile: http://www.sussex.ac.uk/profiles/145874<br>SCSR: http://www.sussex.ac.uk/scsr/    </description>   <dc:date>2014-11-18T13:06:07+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Jan Selby</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BISAENVWG;b39541ee.1411</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BISAENVWG;4670a058.1411">   <title>Reminder: abstracts due for BISA environment panels, London 2015 </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BISAENVWG;4670a058.1411</link>   <description> Dear colleagues,<br><br>Just a quick reminder about the message below. Please send abstracts to me<br>by this Wednesday (earlier if at all possible).<br><br>Best wishes,<br><br>Hayley<br><br>*London 2015 Conference Panels*<br><br>If you are planning to submit an abstract for the London BISA conference<br>&lt;http://bisa.ac.uk/index.php?option=com_content&amp;view=article&amp;id=364&amp;catid=35&amp;Itemid=236&gt;(June<br>2015) on a theme related to the environment, energy, or natural resources,<br>I encourage you to submit it via the Environment Working Group. We<br>can submit 5 panels and we are guaranteed 2. At our members' meeting last<br>week, the following panel topics were suggested as possibilities (not in<br>order of preference): [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2014-11-17T15:00:39+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Hayley Stevenson</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BISAENVWG;4670a058.1411</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BISAENVWG;cb08bca8.1411">   <title>Policy Innovation in a Changing Climate </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BISAENVWG;cb08bca8.1411</link>   <description> A special issue comprising ten new papers (four of them Gold 'Open Access') explore the governance of climate change from a fresh perspective.<br>http://www.tandfonline.com/toc/fenp20/23/5#.VFtNffmsV8G<br><br>Governance gaps are arising from the struggle to seal the deal on a comprehensive new international agreement. But failure at the international level should not, the authors argue, be confused with a lack of innovation at national and sub-national levels. Policy innovation in these domains should, however, be analysed holistically, in terms of invention, diffusion and evaluation. The challenges that arise from doing so are systematically explored against studies of policy innovation dynamics in relation to [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2014-11-13T09:14:32+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Andy Jordan (ENV)</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BISAENVWG;cb08bca8.1411</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BISAENVWG;e4275691.1411">   <title>BISA Postgrad Conference: call for environmental panel </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BISAENVWG;e4275691.1411</link>   <description> Message from Paul Tobin to postgrad members of the Environment Working<br>Group:<br><br>Following last year\ufffd\ufffd\ufffds biggest ever BISA Postgraduate Network conference in<br>Dublin, Ireland,<br>&lt;http://bisapgn.com/events/past-conferences/pgn-conference-2014/&gt; this<br>year\ufffd\ufffd\ufffds BISA PGN Annual Conference will be taking place at King\ufffd\ufffd\ufffds College<br>London in the heart of London. It will take place on the 30th March, 2015,<br>it is free to attend and there are bursaries available for travel. [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2014-11-12T06:43:22+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Hayley Stevenson</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BISAENVWG;e4275691.1411</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BISAENVWG;1c3594b1.1411">   <title>BISA Environment WG Membership - good news </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BISAENVWG;1c3594b1.1411</link>   <description> Dear BISA Environment working group colleagues,<br><br>Just a note to say thanks to everyone who recently signed up for BISA<br>membership - and to those who have continued their support. I am delighted<br>that our numbers have increased to 32, just above the threshold to apply<br>for \ufffd\ufffd3000 in funding for 2015.<br><br>This actually makes us one of the larger BISA working groups (the average<br>number of members is about 28). [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2014-11-03T15:41:57+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Hayley Stevenson</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BISAENVWG;1c3594b1.1411</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BISAENVWG;df87af21.1410">   <title>Taskforce on Advancing the Conceptual Foundations of Earth System Governance </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BISAENVWG;df87af21.1410</link>   <description> Dear all,<br><br>You may be interested in becoming involved in this new international<br>taskforce on the Conceptual Foundations of Earth System Governance. It<br>should be a really exciting initiative.<br><br>See details here:<br>http://www.earthsystemgovernance.org/news/2014-10-22-advancing-conceptual-foundations-earth-system-governance<br><br>Questions to James Meadowcroft: (james.meadowcroft@carleton.ca)<br><br>Best wishes,<br>Hayley   </description>   <dc:date>2014-10-23T18:15:20+01:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Hayley Stevenson</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BISAENVWG;df87af21.1410</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BISAENVWG;896b5b82.1410">   <title>BISA 2015 - Environment Group Panel: Ethics and Politics of Convergence </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BISAENVWG;896b5b82.1410</link>   <description> Dear all<br><br>It was great to meet new and old environment group members last week in<br>Sheffield.<br><br>It just occurred to me that a book I have been asked to edit for the<br>Schumacher Institute (peer reviewed) fits right into the BISA theme of<br>'Worlds of inequality'.<br><br>The title of the proposed book is 'Ethics and Politics of Convergence'. [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2014-10-22T17:37:16+01:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Lucy Ford</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BISAENVWG;896b5b82.1410</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BISAENVWG;bdc0a635.1410">   <title>Call for papers: BISA 2015 panel on 'Green Africa' </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BISAENVWG;bdc0a635.1410</link>   <description> Green Africa: Environmental politics and transformations in governance<br>Panel proposal for BISA Annual Conference, 16th to 19th June 2015, London<br>This panel will debate the range of new manifestations of 'green-ness' in Sub-Saharan Africa. In some arenas the notion of green-ness is ignored or overlooked, while in others it is becoming a powerful organising principle. Africa has been largely overlooked in the debate about 'Green States' (Dryzek et al, 2003; Eckersley, 2004) yet there are high expectations for the future of a Green Economy across the continent (Death, 2014). The Green Africa Foundation seeks to support sustainable agriculture and natural [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2014-10-22T07:47:14+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Carl Death</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BISAENVWG;bdc0a635.1410</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BISAENVWG;f9748c3f.1410">   <title>BISA Environment WG: October update </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BISAENVWG;f9748c3f.1410</link>   <description> Dear all,<br><br>Please see the following news items below:<br><br>1. Members' meeting, 16 October<br><br>2. London 2015 Conference Panels<br><br>3. Workshop on Normative and Ideational Trends in Global Environmental<br>Politics<br><br>*1. Members' meeting, 16 October*<br><br>We had a very productive members' meeting in Sheffield last week. Please<br>find the minutes attached. This outlines plans for 2015 and our exciting<br>book project! [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2014-10-21T09:44:30+01:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Hayley Stevenson</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BISAENVWG;f9748c3f.1410</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BISAENVWG;7256fb7a.1410">   <title>Important message: BISA membership and Working Group Membership </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BISAENVWG;7256fb7a.1410</link>   <description> Dear all,<br><br>We need to recruit 9 more paid-up members of the BISA Environment Working<br>Group before Friday! We only have 21 paid members and we need 30 to qualify<br>for adequate funding for 2015. We are a small group but some 60 people are<br>on the mailing list - so please do reconsider signing up for BISA<br>membership. See links below.... [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2014-10-20T10:16:37+01:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Hayley Stevenson</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BISAENVWG;7256fb7a.1410</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BISAENVWG;4f899c8c.1410">   <title>2nd Cfp Bisa 2015: The Place of Technology in Environmental Politics </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BISAENVWG;4f899c8c.1410</link>   <description> Update: Routledge have expressed an interest in developing an edited book based on this panel.<br><br>Apologies for cross-posting<br><br>Call for papers: British International Studies Association 40th Anniversary Conference, London, 16-19th June 2015 http://www.bisa.ac.uk/index.php?option=com_content&amp;view=article&amp;id=364&amp;Itemid=236<br><br>*The Place of Technology in Environmental Politics*<br><br>Technology has an uneasy place in environmental politics. Technological optimism/pessimism dominated its early debates. Many of its classic texts, like Carson’s Silent Spring, are critiques of technologies. Green social movements often crystallised around opposition to developments like nuclear power. It may, however, be time for a reappraisal of where technology stands in the discipline. Ecological modernisation, especially its more radical [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2014-10-20T01:18:30+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Michael Keary [mkk06]</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BISAENVWG;4f899c8c.1410</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BISAENVWG;7ac07e61.1410">   <title>Call for papers: funded workshop \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd \ufffd\ufffd\ufffdClimate Change Policy and Governance: Initiation, Experimentation and Evaluation</title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BISAENVWG;7ac07e61.1410</link>   <description> Call for papers: funded workshop \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd ‘Climate Change Policy and Governance: Initiation, Experimentation and Evaluation<br>12-13 March 2015, Helsinki<br>This workshop takes a fresh look at what can be learned from experiments and attempts at experimentation in the context of climate change governance. The focus is on experimenting as a broader societal/governance phenomenon and on the ways experiments materialize and challenge existing policies, practices and regulatory systems. This fully funded workshop encourages exploration of experiments from many different angles with the aim to catalyse thinking about experiments, processes of experimentation and the use of experiments. It is expected to bring [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2014-10-17T15:26:57+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Andy Jordan (ENV)</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BISAENVWG;7ac07e61.1410</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BISAENVWG;96cacbdf.1410">   <title>Important message: BISA membership and Working Group Membership </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BISAENVWG;96cacbdf.1410</link>   <description> Dear all,<br><br>BISA has decided to link working group funding to BISA membership from next<br>year onwards. If you are receiving this email, it means that you are a<br>member of the Working Group (whether or not you are a member of BISA). I'd<br>like to strongly encourage you to either:<br><br>(a) If you are already a paid-up member of BISA, please ensure that you<br>identify an affiliation with the Environment Working Group on this page<br>(you can select up to 3 groups):<br>http://bisa.ac.uk/index.php?option=com_content&amp;view=article&amp;id=375%3Aworking-group-membership-survey&amp;catid=37%3Aworking-groups&amp;Itemid=1 [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2014-10-14T09:36:01+01:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Hayley Stevenson</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BISAENVWG;96cacbdf.1410</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BISAENVWG;5e1c47e3.1410">   <title>Fwd: [gep-ed] Critical Perspectives on the Financialisation of Nature </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BISAENVWG;5e1c47e3.1410</link>   <description> Apologies for cross-posting.<br><br>---------- Forwarded message ----------<br>From: Peter Newell &lt;P.J.Newell@sussex.ac.uk&gt;<br>Date: 13 October 2014 09:50<br>Subject: [gep-ed] Critical Perspectives on the Financialisation of Nature<br>To: &quot;gep-ed@googlegroups.com&quot; &lt;gep-ed@googlegroups.com&gt;<br><br>Dear colleagues,<br><br>Please find attached a call for papers for one and half day workshop for<br>doctoral and early-career researchers on<br><br>*Critical Perspectives on the Financialisation of Nature - Theory, Politics<br>and Practice*. [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2014-10-13T09:52:12+01:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Hayley Stevenson</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BISAENVWG;5e1c47e3.1410</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BISAENVWG;427b3e80.1410">   <title>Fwd: Event for PhD students </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BISAENVWG;427b3e80.1410</link>   <description> Dear all,<br><br>Please see details below for an event of the BISA Postgraduate Network.<br>Please share with your departments and PhD students (they don't need to<br>already be members of the BISA PGN).<br><br>All questions to Paul Tobin: paul.tobin@york.ac.uk<br><br>Best wishes,<br>Hayley<br><br>Thriving and not just surviving your PhD!Friday November 7th 2014, 10:00 \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd<br>17:00<br>The Centenary Gallery, Parkinson Court, University of Leeds [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2014-10-10T13:58:38+01:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Hayley Stevenson</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BISAENVWG;427b3e80.1410</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BISAENVWG;39fa7b80.1410">   <title>Postdoctoral opportunities in global environmental governance and global justice </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BISAENVWG;39fa7b80.1410</link>   <description> Dear all,<br><br>The Centre for Deliberative Democracy and Global Governance at the<br>University of Canberra has advertised two postdoctoral positions in (1)<br>global justice, and (2) global environmental governance to work with<br>Professor John Dryzek on his new ARC Laureate Fellowship project. Please<br>forward to your networks and potential applicants.<br><br>http://www.governanceinstitute.edu.au/about-the-institute/centres/deliberative-democracy-and-global-governance#fellowships<br>(Click<br>on &quot;fellowships&quot; if it doesn't automatically appear) [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2014-10-04T16:46:29+01:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Hayley Stevenson</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BISAENVWG;39fa7b80.1410</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BISAENVWG;2d59b2a8.1410">   <title>Call for papers Bisa 2015: The Place of Technology in Environmental Politics </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BISAENVWG;2d59b2a8.1410</link>   <description> Call for papers: British International Studies Association 40th Anniversary Conference, London, 16-19th June 2015<br><br>The Place of Technology in Environmental Politics<br><br>Organiser: Michael Keary, Aberystwyth University<br><br>Technology has an uneasy place in environmental politics. Technological optimism/pessimism dominated its early debates. Many of its classic texts, like Carson’s Silent Spring, are critiques of technologies. Green social movements often crystallised around opposition to developments like nuclear power. It may, however, be time for a reappraisal of where technology stands in the discipline. Ecological modernisation, especially its more radical strands, has won many adherents. Renewable technologies, championed early by green activists and scholars, [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2014-10-03T14:42:44+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Michael Keary [mkk06]</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BISAENVWG;2d59b2a8.1410</dc:identifier> </item>   </rdf:RDF>
